titleStmt.title: Description of Free Library of Philadelphia Lewis O 191: Deccani portrait album.

licence.#text: These images and the content of Rare Book Department Lewis O 191: Deccani portrait album. are free of known copyright restrictions and in the public domain. See the Creative Commons Public Domain Mark page for usage details, http://creativecommons.org/publicdomain/mark/1.0/.

To the extent possible under law, Free Library of Philadelphia, Special Collections has waived all copyright and related or neighboring rights to this metadata about Rare Book Department Lewis O 191: Deccani portrait album.. This work is published from: United States. For a summary of CC0, see https://creativecommons.org/publicdomain/zero/1.0/. Legal code: https://creativecommons.org/publicdomain/zero/1.0/legalcode.

note: Catalog entry, number 190, pasted into back inside cover. Memorandum describing the manuscript written in ink pasted to second flyleaf verso at front of book.

msContents.summary: Deccani portrait album beginning with the Mughal emperors, proceeding to the Deccani kings, then closing with the Safavid shahs; the images are labeled in Persian in the lower corner with Latin script titles added near the shoulder of each person. Possibly produced during the reign of Abul Hasan Qutb Shah (r. 1672-1687) the last ruler of the Golconda sultanate. The album is bound to be viewed left to right; probably for export to Europe.

name.#text: Free Library of Philadelphia. Rare Book Department. John Frederick Lewis Collection of Oriental Manuscripts

supportDesc.extent: ii, 98, ii leaves : 297 x 185 (233 x 128) mm, bound to 298 x 190 mm
supportDesc.foliation: Modern foliation added in pencil, upper outer corner on interleaves. Each image has a blank leaf bound between that bears the same foliation number as the following leaf.

layoutDesc.layout: One central image on each page; border-ruled.

scriptDesc.scriptNote: Labels in naskh in black ink; pointed.

decoNote: Paintings are in bright colors on bright backgrounds; border-ruled in gold with gold floral marginal fill.

decoNote.#text: Note about manuscript in ink in English

binding.p: Bound in red leather over pasteboard with gilt-stamped central mandorla, two pendants on the vertical axis, cornerpieces and frame; red leather doublure; marbled paper endleaves; spine stamped "The Mogol Dress".

origin.p: The item is undated, likely created in Golconda between 1670-1699.

provenance: Formerly owned by Earl Grenville (memorandum and catalog entry).
Formerly owned by Clarence H. Clark (bookplate, inside back cover).
Sold at the Clark sale, 30 November 1909 at the Samuel T. Freedman & Co. book auction rooms (note in pencil on memorandum, second front flyleaf verso).
Formerly owned by John Frederick Lewis (bookplate, back flyleaf verso).
